intro: Myrsine jaliscensis, commonly known as the Jalisco myrsine, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a smooth texture with a glossy appearance. The flowers are small, white, and clustered in umbels, adding to its ornamental value.
